009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.abs;
013import static java.lang.Math.max;
014import static java.lang.Math.pow;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
018import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
019
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * Calculates orthogonal projections of points onto an ellipse using
024 * Newton-based iterative root finding.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * <strong>NOTE:</strong> This version is quick but may fail to return a valid result if the 
028 * target point is close to the x- or y-axis.
029 * See {@link OrthogonalEllipseProjector} for a robust solution
030 * or {@link ConfocalConicEllipseProjector} for an approximate but
031 * non-iterative (i.e., fast) alternative.
032 * </p>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @see OrthogonalEllipseProjector
036 * @see ConfocalConicEllipseProjector
037 */
038public class OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton extends EllipseProjector {
039        
040        private final static double NewtonMinStep = 1e-6;
041        private final static int MaxIterations = 100;
042        
043        private final double ra, rb, ra2, rb2;
044        private int lastIterationCount = 0;     // number of root-finding iterations performed in last projection
045        
046        public OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton(GeometricEllipse ellipse) {
047                super(ellipse);
048                this.ra = ellipse.ra;
049                this.rb = ellipse.rb;
050                this.ra2 = sqr(ra);
051                this.rb2 = sqr(rb);
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        protected double[] projectCanonical(double[] u1) {
056                // coordinates of p (mapped to first quadrant)
057                final double u = u1[0]; 
058                final double v = u1[1]; 
059                
060                double[] ub = null;     // the unknown ellipse point
061
062                if (u + v < 1e-6) {     // (u,v) is very close to the ellipse center; u,v >= 0
063                        ub = new double[] {0, rb};
064                }
065                else {                                          
066                        double t = max(ra * u - ra2, rb * v - rb2);
067                        double gprev = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
068                        double deltaT, deltaG;
069                        int k = 0;
070                        do {
071                                k = k + 1;
072                                double g  = sqr((ra * u) / (t + ra2)) + sqr((rb * v) / (t + rb2)) - 1;
073                                double dg = 2 * (sqr(ra * u) / pow(t + ra2, 3) + sqr(rb * v) / pow(t + rb2, 3));
074                                deltaT = g / dg;
075                                t = t + deltaT;                         // Newton iteration
076                                
077                                // in rare cases g(t) is very flat and checking deltaT is not enough for convergence!
078                                deltaG = g - gprev;                     // change of g value
079                                gprev = g;      
080                                
081                        }  while(abs(deltaT) > NewtonMinStep && abs(deltaG) > NewtonMinStep && k < MaxIterations);
082                        
083                        lastIterationCount = k;         // remember iteration count
084                        
085                        if (k >= MaxIterations) {
086                                throw new RuntimeException("max. mumber of iterations exceeded");
087                        }
088                        
089                        ub = new double[] {ra2 * u / (t + ra2), rb2 * v / (t + rb2)};
090                }
091                return ub;
092        }
093
094        // for statistics only
095        
096        public int getLastIterationCount() {
097                return this.lastIterationCount;
098        }
099        
100
101        // -------------------------------------------------
102
103        public static void main(String[] args) {
104                PrintPrecision.set(8);
105                
106//              Ellipse ell = new Ellipse(5, 3, 1, 1, 1.1);
107//              Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(6, 1);
108                
109                // critical case: 
110//               GeometricEllipse ell = new GeometricEllipse(353613.76725979, 987.23614032, 353503.20032614, -9010.22308359, 3.11555492);
111//               Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(30.000000000, 210.000000000);
112                 
113                        GeometricEllipse ell = new GeometricEllipse(6, 5, 0, 0, 0);
114//                      Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(1, 0);
115//                      Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(6, 0);
116                        Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(0.1, 0.1);
117                
118                 OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton(ell);
119                
120                System.out.println("p  = " + p);
121                Pnt2d p0 = projector.project(p);
122                System.out.println("p0 = " + p0);
123                System.out.println("iterations  = " + projector.getLastIterationCount());
124                
125                System.out.println("dist = " + projector.getDistance(p.toDoubleArray()));
126        }
127
128}
